definition: handsome/refined/elegant/graceful/superior/show (loanword)/CL:場|场[chang2]/(literary) to grow/to bloom/(of crops) to produce ears
tea stain (on the inside of a tea pot, tea cup etc)
a blade will get rusty if it is not sharpened; a man will fall behind if he doesn't study (idiom)
pinyin: dao1 bu4 mo2 yao4 sheng1 xiu4 , ren2 bu4 xue2 yao4 luo4 hou4
containing_words.word: 刀不磨要生锈，人不学要落后

definition: a "screw that never rusts" — sb who selflessly and wholeheartedly serves the Communist Party, like Lei Feng 雷鋒|雷锋[Lei2 Feng1], to whom the metaphor is attributed
pinyin: yong3 bu4 sheng1 xiu4 de5 luo2 si1 ding1

definition: (bird species of China) rusty-flanked treecreeper (Certhia nipalensis)
pinyin: xiu4 hong2 fu4 xuan2 mu4 que4

definition: (bird species of China) slaty-backed flycatcher (Ficedula hodgsonii)
(bird species of China) rusty-bellied shortwing (Brachypteryx hyperythra)

sentences.english: Use 2 to 3 minutes eash time, it can be used for around two weeks.
sentences.chinese: 用2至3分钟的时间锈，它可以用于两个星期左右。

sentences.english: As iron is eaten away by rust , so the envious are consumed by their own passion.
sentences.chinese: 就像铁被锈腐蚀，嫉妒被本身的情感毁灭。

sentences.english: I put some oil on the squeaky hinge.
sentences.chinese: 我给锈得吱吱响的铰链上了点油。

sentences.english: So it was better to take the backcross method than other methods in anti-strip rust breeding.
sentences.chinese: 由此在抗条锈育种上采用回交方法的效果较好。

sentences.english: Shimmery deep gold, with an opaque rusty brown base.
sentences.chinese: 不透明锈褐色基调上闪耀着深金色。

sentences.english: Stem rust produces reddish brown reddish-brown spots on the stems of infected plants.
sentences.chinese: 秆锈在感染的作物的茎上有微红黄色的斑点。

sentences.english: Can use the small-scale wind-driven or electric rust removing the shelf above.
sentences.chinese: 可以使用小型风动或电动除去货架上面的锈。

sentences.english: In the room there was a huge stove overlaid with rust.
sentences.chinese: 房间中有一个长满了锈的大炉子。

sentences.english: It also nice to smudge a little on the decal layer and the "wind" layer.
sentences.chinese: 将你的花纹图层和“风化”图层弄锈一点也不错。
我认为你们脑袋都锈逗了。

sentences.english: Can iron combine with water and oxygen to form rust?
sentences.chinese: 铁与水及氧气结合会生成锈吗？

sentences.english: I found an old rusty wood-saw without any handle;
sentences.chinese: 我找到了一把生满了锈的旧锯子，连把子也没有。

sentences.english: It is doing even better against stem rust.
sentences.chinese: 在抗秆锈能力上甚至更胜一筹。

sentences.english: I'd give my kids rusty nails and battery acid.
sentences.chinese: 我只给我的孩子锈钉子和蓄电池酸液。

sentences.english: This car's worth next to nothing, which's full of rust.
sentences.chinese: 这辆生满锈的车一文不值。

sentences.english: Your gold and silver is cankered; and the rust of them shall be a witness against you, and shall eat your flesh as it were fire.

definition: brass (alloy of copper 銅|铜[tong2] and zinc 鋅|锌[xin1])
to split/to crack/to break open/to rend
to cast in metal/(fig.) to forge/to fashion
